entry.title: Re: Delivery adress of plant not taking in account
entry.content:
Hi,

To ensure the system derives the correct delivery address, the following configuration steps must be performed and verified:

1. SSCUI 105933 – Maintain Storage Location

  • For Plant and Storage Location , maintain the delivery (ship-to) address:
  • Ensure all fields (street, postal code, city, region, and country) are completed. This configuration defines the address that the system uses as the delivery address for purchase orders.

 

2. SSCUI 102657 – Set Warehouse Address

  • Go to SSCUI 102657 – Set Warehouse Address.
  • For Warehouse, maintain the same delivery address as above. This ensures warehouse-related logistics documents (such as inbound/outbound deliveries) use the same physical address.

 

3. SSCUI 102125 – Define Shipping Point

  • Go to SSCUI 102125 – Define Shipping Point.
  • For Shipping Points, maintain the correct delivery address corresponding to the warehouse location. Consistent address data ensures proper address determination in delivery-related processes.

 

4. Manage Business Partner Master Data

  • Open the “Manage Business Partner Master Data” app.
  • For BP, create and maintain:
    • BILL-TO address: XYZ
    • SHIP-TO address: ABC
  • Assign address types correctly and ensure roles are consistent with supplier functions. These addresses are used for communication and output (not for internal PO address determination).

 

Validate:

  1. Create a new Purchase Order.
  2. Use Plant and Storage Location.
  3. Check the Delivery Address tab — it should now display the storage location address instead of the bill-to address.
  4. Test PO output to confirm that:
    • Delivery Address on the form corresponds to the storage location (ship-to).
    • Invoice Address corresponds to the bill-to address from the Business Partner.

Thanks and regards,

SAP Support

entry.title: Re: Mass update of Classification Class in Material Master
entry.content:
Hi,

It is possible to assign multiple materials using transaction CLMM and button "Set and Change values".  It is not the most obvious transaction to use, but it works.  I don't know if there is a limitation on the number of materials you can do at one time, but I had no issues with 250+ materials.

You need to go on the 3rd tab (Assignments) and enter the class with Create button selected, then go to the 2nd tab (Target Objects) and paste the materials with the copy clipboard button at the bottom.

CLMM can then be used again to assign correct characteristics values in a separate step after the class has been assigned.

Steve

entry.title: Input data to Webi report
entry.content:
This is my first time posting here so please redirect this to the proper board if needed. I was not able to find one specifically for BO/Webi.

I have a webi document that is 2 queries merged on a product ID. It is a sales report that is displaying objects from the universe and some user created variables that are performing calculations. There is one piece of data that is needed in the report that is not available in the universe and it is only for certain products and the product could change each time they run the report (monthly). I created a user input that allows me to enter a value and save it to a variable to be displayed in the report. The problem is it is displaying for all products. Also, I just realized that while my product selection input is a multi-list my first input only allows for a single amount to be entered. Is there a way to enter multiple amounts to be linked with multiple games (i.e. $500/ Product 12345, $750/Product 54321)?

entry.title: Business Goal percentage not calculating correctly
entry.content:
We have a pretty straight forward Bonus Plan

Business Goals - 90%

Individual Goals 10%

Under the business goal section, there could be 3 - 23 goals with weights adding up to that 90%. However it seems it is multiplying the dollar amount of the award first by the 90% section weight then again by the individual goal weight, decreasing the goals payout percentage. What we found is we have to put the Business Goal section at 100% and just have the individual goals add up to 90% to make it calculate correctly, however, visually this doesn't look like what we are asking for, (business goal 90%, Ind 10%).

If you look at the 2 screen shots to see the difference. When configured as you would assume, business goal section 90% individual 10% the total amount for business goals on a $1,100 Bonus payout should be $990, however it is again multiplying it by 90% and making it $891.  It looks correct, in that it says "Business Performance Goal Section Weight 90%" and Business Section Amount $990.00, but the total for that section is only $891? Can you explain this?

entry.title: Re: Reconciliation Accounts Payable after Advanced Foreig...
entry.content:
App "Manage Supplier Line Items" contains the information of the entry view table BSEG.

The advanced foreign currency valuation postings are only updated in the ACDOCA table - Posting in General Ledger Only and not the BSEG table.


as referenced in blog

https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/advanced-foreign-currency-valuation-in-s-4hana-cloud-cloud-erp/ba-p/13562579


"Document posted through this will not be seen in Manage Supplier Line Items or Manage Customer Line Items app. But it will be seen in Display Line Items in General Ledger app."


In classical valuation it is also not the case that the valuation posting is made directly on the supplier/customer, it is made to a balance sheet adjustment account and offsetting gain/loss account. Customers for classical valuation can use the Balance Sheet/Incoming statement to review balances on customer/Supplier account with the adjustment account in same grouping.

In the advanced valuation there is no posting to the balance sheet adjustment account for the customer/Supplier rather there is posting on account itself.

Likewise you can use the App Balance Sheet/Income Statement to review balance on account.

In the app Display General Ledger Line Items you can use filter Business Transaction types to filter/distinguish sources on account. For example Business transaction type RFCV is used for Foreign currency Valuation.

entry.title: Re: Alternative Unit of Measures for different products
entry.content:
Dear Lakshmipathi,

thanks for your reply. I did the following steps:

1. Removed Meter from Stock-Specific UoM in Customizing (Extended Warehouse Management à Master Data à Product à Define Unit of Measure Attributes)

2. Maintained Preferred UoM in EWM Product Master

  • For Product A, set Preferred UoM = Pieces
  • For Product B, set Preferred UoM = Meters


This setting works for Product A, where BuoM is the same as the preferred UoM. For Product B, where the preferred UoM is not equal to the BuoM, the Inbound Delivery and the Putaway Warehouse Tasks are created in BuoM and not in the preferred UoM, which set in /SCWM/MAT1. The preferred unit of measure in the material master is not taken into account in the inbound delivery or in the warehouse tasks. What could be the reason for this?

entry.title: Re: Streamline Data Migration from SAP ECC to SAP S/4HANA: Selective Data Transition with Time-Slice
entry.content:
Hello @matthiasstegmue 

Our customer is currently running SAP ECC 6.0 and planning a conversion to S/4HANA 2023 or 2025, hosted on RISE with SAP (Private Cloud ERP).

Using the S/4HANA sizing tool, the projected target HANA database size is around 2 TB, which is considered quite large  . Since the customer is not keen on starting a prerequisite and expensive archiving project, we explored the use of SAP Lean System Discovery Tool (SDT).

As shown in the attached screenshot, we have completed the Digital Blueprint phase, and the results are very promising , showing over 50% footprint reduction.

 

My question is: how should this reduction be interpreted in terms of hardware resources?

We are in the process of building the BOM for the Private Cloud ERP migration, and we need to come up with realistic sizing numbers , specifically:

  • Expected HANA memory size

  • Expected HANA disk size

Would it be correct to assume that the 50% footprint reduction directly translates into a ~1 TB target HANA database size (i.e., 50% of the original 2 TB estimate)?

Or is it not that straightforward, and the only accurate way to estimate the target HANA database size using Lean SDT is to perform a full sandbox conversion run?

Any insight or reference from those who have done this in practice would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks,

entry.title: Duplicate production entries 101 using BAPI VHURM_HU_POST_WE_PROD_ORDER
entry.content:
Hello experts,

We are working with a custom program that posts production confirmations using the BAPI VHURM_HU_POST_WE_PROD_ORDER, which internally calls transaction COWBHUWE to register production goods receipts in EWM, already packed in HUs (Handling Units).

We're encountering the following issue:

 

❗ Unexpected behavior:

In very rare cases, the system is duplicating the 101 movement for a production order. That is, it creates two separate material documents, each with a different batch number, for the same order.

📌 Observations:

  • The duplicated movements occur at exactly the same second, or at most one second apart.
  • This suggests a possible concurrency issue or race condition during execution.

⚙️ Technical details:

  • In the it_hulist parameter (which specifies how many 101 movements should be posted), we are explicitly passing only one line.
  • Despite this, in about 2 out of every 500 production orders, a partial production receipt gets duplicated.

❓ Question:

Has anyone experienced this kind of duplication using the BAPI VHURM_HU_POST_WE_PROD_ORDER or in similar EWM + HU scenarios?
Do you know how we can prevent this unexpected behavior?

Any help or suggestions would be greatly appreciated.

entry.title: Re: Redraw mdk page SAP Service Asset Manager after filter
entry.content:
It all depends on what you are really trying to do.  Do you really want to define a persistent filter for the page or are you wanting just to search for the scanned value?

From reading your question it almost sounds more like search is what you want.  Otherwise you will need to also provide a way to clear the persistent filter value.  For searching, after you can the NFC tag and have the value you can just set it as the search string to have the standard search logic filter down the list as if the user had typed in the value manually.  The user can then clear the search to return to the full list using the existing search bar functions.

Here is an example of setting the search value from a rule.

// Set the serach value to the scan value
let sectionTable = context.getPageProxy().getControl('SectionedTable');
sectionTable.searchString = scanVal;

entry.title: SAP PaPM Cloud Standard Model: What’s New as of 2025-10-06?
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community members,

Welcome to the latest update from the SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud (SAP PaPM Cloud) Standard Model What’s New series! This update brings a fresh set of powerful features and usability enhancements designed to make everyday tasks faster, smarter, and more intuitive.

We’ve introduced conversation history for Joule, giving you a smoother and more personalized experience with improved intelligent assistance. In Content Management, environment locking during import now helps ensure safer and more consistent data handling. We’ve also made a few refinements in Modeling Settings to further enhance performance and usability. Finally, to make guidance easier to access, embedded help via SAP Companion is now available right where you need it.

Let’s take a closer look at what’s new and how these updates can make your SAP PaPM Cloud Standard Model experience even better.

Report Management | Joule

Great news! You no longer have to worry about losing past conversations. In the Joule panel header, you'll now find a new hamburger menu icon that opens the History sidebar. All your conversations are stored here and are easily accessible.

Regardless of which environment you are in, you will see all your past conversations in the Joule History panel. This allows you to continue your previous conversation in a new environment, ask about content from that environment, and compare it to the previous one. The conversations are private, which means they are visible only to you.

The title for each conversation in the sidebar is generated automatically. Joule utilizes your first message to create a concise and clear title, making it easy to identify the topic of the chat.

Conversations are arranged chronologically, with the most recent ones appearing at the top. The currently active chat is visually highlighted, so you always know where you are.

A new button + New Conversation has been added to the top of the Joule History panel, allowing users to create new chats. You can still use the existing button in the main Joule header as well—both options provide a clean and fresh chat window.

Joule's responses have improved. After each reply, you'll see “quick replies” options, shortcuts that let you continue the conversation without typing long follow-up questions. This speeds up interactions and makes them more intuitive.

Note: Quick replies are available only with the "gpt-4o" AI model, since the "anthropic-claude-3.5-sonnet" model doesn't support follow-up messages.

Another small but important update – the Joule icon has been moved to the header. It's now always visible, even when the Properties panel is open, making it easier to switch between panels.

 

Administration | Content Management

In one of our previous What’s New updates, we introduced environment locking  during imports in SAP PaPM Cloud Standard Model to prevent conflicts and ensure data integrity. Building on that, we’ve now enhanced this functionality when using the “Overwrite Environment” option in Content Management, making it even more robust.

Here’s what’s new in this update:

  • When the user starts an import with "Overwrite" option, the system now locks the environment until the process completes.
  • If the user tries to access Data Management, Process Management, Report Management, or Visualize screen while import is running, they’ll see a message: “Environment import in progress.”

To show you how this enhancement works, there are two ways this happens.

  • User A is currently in the Modeling screen and making some changes, then User B starts importing the environment that User A is currently working on.
    User A tries to:
    • Access the Data Management screen or the Show screen.
    • Save changes.
    • Navigate to the Process Management or Report Management application.

      The system displays the message below:
  • User A is currently importing the environment with the “Overwrite Environment” option set to “Yes”.
    User B wants to access the following applications:
    • Modeling application
    • Process Management application from the Environment application
    • Report Management application from the Environment application

      The system displays the same message:

 

Administration | Settings

Modeling Settings: Customize RFA Template

Previously, we have released a blogpost introducing the SAP PAPM Cloud Standard Model - RFA's field customization feature which initially supported only the following two Remote Function Adapter (RFA) types: Finance General Ledger and Finance General Ledger Items. As of today, we are glad to inform you that SAP PaPM Cloud Standard Model now also supports the creation of custom mapping fields for additional RFA types such as:

  • Finance Accounts Payable
  • Finance Accounts Payable Items
  • Finance Accounts Receivable
  • Finance Accounts Receivable Items

For more details, visit Modeling Settings on Help Portal.

 

Introducing In-App Help via SAP Companion

We’re excited to introduce the embedded help content to the SAP Profitability and Performance Management (SAP PaPM) Cloud Standard Model powered by SAP Companion.

SAP Companion brings powerful contextual assistance directly into your workflow. You can access key information about the application without needing to switch to external documentation. For more detailed information and step-by-step procedures, the SAP Help Portal remains the primary source.

So far, SAP Companion support has been rolled out for the following applications:

  • Environments
  • Modeling
  • Process Management

Other applications will be supported soon, further expanding in-app support across the platform.

To learn more about different functionalities of the abovementioned applications while inside the app itself, here’s what you need to do:

  1. Navigate to any of the supported apps, for example, Modeling.
  2. Choose the "?" icon in the top-right corner of the header toolbar.
    This action opens the in-app help overlay on the right-hand side of the screen.

  3. Use the search bar inside the in-app help panel to quickly search for help topics or explore them in the list.
  4. When you hover over a specific help topic from the list, the system points you to the UI element for which the help topic is created. Once you choose the topic, the system displays a more detailed description of the selected topic.

     

    You can also do it the other way around – choose the “?” icon next to a UI element to open the detailed help topic that describes it.

     

Note:
• SAP PaPM Standard Model currently does not include guided tours. For now, we offer static help and searchable documentation within supported applications.
• Currently, in-app help is available only in the English language.

That's it for this update! 

We hope these new features and enhancements make your experience with SAP PaPM Cloud Standard Model even better. To catch up on earlier releases, visit our PaPMCloudWhatsNew tag.

Stay tuned — more exciting updates are on the way!

entry.title: Re: VA35N layout different in S4 then ECC
entry.content:
Transactions such as VA35N (List of Sales Orders) and VL71 (Output from Deliveries) have undergone layout and UI changes in S/4HANA due to the adoption of SAP Fiori and the simplified data model. These changes are part of SAP’s modernization strategy and are not easily reversible.

While you cannot fully revert to ECC-style screens, you do have some options:

Use GUI Transactions Instead of Fiori Apps. If your system supports it, you can still access classic GUI versions of transactions via SAP GUI for Windows. This may offer a more familiar layout.

Customize Screen Layouts via Personalization. You can personalize layouts using SAP GUI options (e.g., ALV grid settings) and Fiori personalization (limited but useful for field visibility and order)

Create Custom Z-Transactions - If the layout change significantly impacts business processes, you can work with your ABAP team to create custom transactions that mimic ECC behavior.

entry.title: Troubleshooting Document Grounding Pipelines
entry.content:
This article will cover an in-depth look into the Document Grounding Service. Including a deep dive into its MS Sharepoint Integration and a collection of issues we usually encounter with the setup routine of pipelines for Document Grounding in Joule.

The scenario: We have implemented Joule and want to enable it to consume company specific knowledge documents. In that process we follow the documentation assets to setup Document Grounding. In this sequence, we face difficulties or unclarities. This blog post should be a starting point to understand different troubleshooting vectors to successfully register a  Sharepoint with Document Grounding.

 

 

Step 1: Validate access to the Document Grounding API:

Once the service instance is successfully set up following the official documentation, the next step is to use the Document Grounding API to create a pipeline—typically targeting a source like SharePoint. This setup process remains largely manual and can be cumbersome.

The service keys provided by BTP include an X.509 certificate and key, embedded within a JSON structure. These must be manually extracted and saved as separate .crt and .key files.

Here’s how to troubleshoot this step-by-step:

Check 1: Can you obtain a token for the Document Grounding API:

Before interacting with the Document Grounding API, verify that you have the correct url, client_id, and the required certificates. These credentials are essential for authenticating against the API.

Start by performing a POST request to the authorization endpoint to obtain a bearer token. This step confirms that your setup is valid and that the API is reachable.

Here’s what the response should look like:

Subsequently you would use the bearer token in the next request to the URL of the Document Grounding Service.

Typical symptoms that might occur are 4xx errors on the very first "Get Token" request you try. If you are not able to retrieve the bearer token - that most likely means there is an issue with the way you formulated the request. Ensure that your API client (recommendation here is Bruno) is passing the needed details correctly.

Points to watch out: 

  1. URL
  2. Client ID
  3. Client Certificate including the proper wildcard - needs to match the URL

If these three points are good, you will be able to obtain the bearer token. Let's go through some possible issues:

Symptom 1:  "401 invalid_client - Client not found"

Typical issue: The client_id is missing as part of the URL params.

Symptom 2: "401 invalid_client - Bad credentials":

Typical issue: The client certificate is either missing or not the right certificate for this client id.

Symptom 3: "404 Not found":

Typical issue: The URL is incorrect. Ensure that it ends on the /oauth2/token

Symptom 4: "400 Error":

Typical issue: The URL is incorrect. Ensure that it ends on the /oauth2/token (in this example it was /oauth2/authorize - copied directly from the key instead of correcting it)

Symptom 5: "OPENSSL BAD_BASE64_DECODE":

Typical issue: The certificate or the key file is incorrectly formatted. 

 

Check 2: Are you able to access the Document Grounding Pipeline API:

Given the bearer token, now it is time to try accessing the Document Grounding pipeline API. Typically you would do that in order to create the pipeline. Since usually the next request already would be the pipeline creation - and we might have two hard to distinguish error categories here - I recommend to try the simplest GET request the Grounding API has. 

So execute a GET on /pipelines to double check if you do get a valid response from the API. You want to retrieve a 200 OK response code and a body with a most likely empty list of pipelines.

 

This way you can be sure that in general you talk to the API correctly. If you are prompted with errors in that step - then you need to double check the following points:

  1. URL
  2. Client ID
  3. Bearer Token in "Authorization" header needs to be there and valid (it expires after x hours)
  4. Client Certificate in place with proper wildcard for this URL as well

If you do not get a 200 response - most likely you are again doing something wrong in the formulation of the request to the API:

Symptom 1: "401 Unauthorized. Ensure you have proper token and subscription"

Typical Issue: The request is missing a proper bearer token - or it is invalid by now.

Symptom 2: "404 Not found"

Typical Issue: The URL is wrong.

 

Now that you can be sure that you are indeed able to talk to the API of Document Grounding - we can come to the next challenge:

 

Step 2: Validate SharePoint Credentials:

The most frequent issue we encounter when customers set up Document Grounding for SharePoint is misconfigured API credentials for the Microsoft Graph SharePoint API. While the process may seem intuitive, it often leads to errors.

In many organizations, Microsoft administration is handled by dedicated departments. As a result, teams rarely receive the correct credentials with the necessary privileges on the first attempt. Adjusting these credentials typically involves lengthy and bureaucratic procedures.

Let’s quickly review what can go wrong:

Symptom 1: "401 External system returned an unexpected response"

Typical Issue: The credentials to the MS Graph API you maintained in the Destination do not have access to the respective API on Microsoft end to access the SharePoint sites documents.

Deep Dive Investigating Access Issues on Microsoft Entra side:

Now for this specific symptom we need to deep dive. The reason is - from the document grounding service - we get this generic 401 error message. But this is usually no big help to figure out what exactly is wrong with the credentials. There can be several possible reasons:

  1. Invalid Client ID / Client Secret values - could be a simple typo
  2. URL's - the SharePoint site URL, as well as the token service URL could be wrong
  3. Missing permissions in general
  4. Missing permission on that specific SharePoint site

So let's dive into it step by step.

The first thing I highly recommend is to use the App registration in combination with the Site.selected permission set. In the official document grounding API we also offer the possibility to use a "Oauth2Password" flow - but in general talking to many customers and Microsoft admins - the clear preference from a data governance and technical perspective is for sure the App registration. There are several reasons for this: One for example is the ability to restrict the access to only the needed SharePoint sites. The second one are organizational policies. Some orgs require multi factor authentication for the user flow and this is something clearly not possible for a technical service. You can work around it with Ip allow listing - but this is quite cumbersome and error-prone.

That being said - we will concentrate on the recommended way of using "Oauth2ClientCredentials".

How to check the SharePoint credentials and get detailed error messages:

SAP provides a specific note on "How to test the SharePoint API accessibility" https://me.sap.com/notes/3623622/E this note contains a number of cURL requests that can be used to validate what exactly is coming back from the MS Graph API. My clear recommendation here is: Use the requests given here (import them to Bruno) and get clarity on the exact error message. That way you will be able to much better narrow down what needs to be configured on Entra side.

The connection check to SharePoint consists of two steps: Obtaining a bearer token and then accessing the sites contents.

Check 1: Obtain the Microsoft Login Token:

 

Possible symptoms that might occur when you are executing this request:

Symptom 1: Invalid Request scope is missing

Typical Issue: The scope header is missing

Symptom 2: Tenant Identifier is invalid

Typical Issue: You are not using the right tenant ID for your Microsoft Entra tenant.

Symptom 3: App Registration / Client ID not found

Typical Issue: You are using the wrong identifier for your app registration. Ensure to take the (client id) from your app registration.

Symptom 4: Invalid Secret provided

Typical Issue: The secret value you 

 

Check 2: Access the MS Graph SharePoint API with the token:

Now that we can be sure, that the MS App Registration Credentials are in fact valid, we can check if the also have the permissions for that particular sharepoint:

Utilize the "Connect to Sharepoint" request from the Note. The expected response should look like this:

It should give you some details about your site and return with a 200 OK.

Now lets have a look at possible symptoms of permission errors:

Symptom 1: "401 InvalidAuthenticationToken":

Typical Issue: This is just an issue with having an invalid token copied from the first request / or invalidated by time.

 

Symptom 2: "404 Not found":

Typical Issue: This is referring to the part of the URL where you need to input the hostname and the sitename. Ensure that you are using the actual site name and not just some sort of description. Best is to take it directly from the Site URL you also open in the browser.

 

Symptom 3: "401 General Exception":

Typical Issue: This indicates a general issue with the permission to the sharepoint site api - your app registration is most likely missing the sites selected permission or it is not fully granted.

 

In MS Entra this should look like this:

On the App registrations API permission page - you need to ensure to have the Microsoft Graph "Sites.Selected" Permission added - and Status needs to be "Granted for xxx".

Symptom 4: "403 Forbidden Access Denied":

Typical Issue: In case of a 403 Access Denied on the other hand side - it is and indication that again the permissions are the issue - but in this case specifically the link between your app registration and the sharepoint site is missing. Meaning you might have the sites selected application permission granted - but as the name suggests this permission works in the combination with an additional step to setup the link between that app registration and the sharepoint site. 

How to validate Sharepoint Permissions in MS Entra:

This one is a bit harder to validate - because there is no UI in Entra. Instead the admin has the option to either use a PowerShell command to grant this:

Grant-PnPAzureADAppSitePermission -AppId <appId> -DisplayName <name> -Permissions Write

This would respond with a granted message if done correctly.

To validate one can use the following format:

Get-PnPAzureADAppSitePermission -Site https://contoso.sharepoint.com/sites/ProjectX

And again you should get the indication whether your App Registry has the permission to access that specific Sharepoint site.

Alternatively he can use a POST Request via the MS Graph Explorer:

POST https://graph.microsoft.com/v1.0/sites/{siteId}/permissions

The response should include you App Registry:

 

{
  "roles": [ "write" ],
  "grantedToIdentities": [
    {
      "application": {
        "id": "00000000-1111-2222-3333-444444444444",
        "displayName": "MY Azure AD App"
      }
    }
  ]
}

 

Similarly the GET would allow you to see which applications have access to the site. Both ways are similar.

Note: You need to perform the link between the app registration and the sharepoint site for each new site you want to replicate.

Given all these steps - we can be sure that the MS Credentials have the proper permissions for our job.

Step 3: Validate Pipeline Configuration:

Last but not least - given a working set of credentials and being able to retrieve content from the MS side - this should allow us now to create a pipeline. Below there are some additional checks to be done to ensure a proper configuration of the pipeline:

Check 1: SharePoint Site Identifier 

In the step to create the Pipeline - you are asked to provide a site name. This is a bit a tricky one - because SharePoint Sites have a title. A readable nice title -  but this is not necessarily the site identifier. Instead - the name parameter needs to be filled with the ID of the Sharepoint site. And this is best found on the URL.  For example if your Sharepoint is reachable under 

https://contoso.sharepoint.com/sites/HR%20Team

Then the site identifier would be HR%20Team

Note: Be aware of the URL encoding.

A seldom topic that might occur here is that you have a sub-site structure. This is to the best of my knowledge currently not supported by document grounding and sharepoint itself has deprecated this feature.

Check 2: SharePoint include paths

The optional parameter to limit the replication of content into the document grounding service with a include path is also something to watch out for. A typical symptom is that, after configuring an include path, no documents appear in the replication results — indicating that the path definition is likely too restrictive or incorrectly specified.

The easiest way to validate this is by checking directly in SharePoint. In this example, I’m using the default document library, “Shared Documents”, and have created a folder named “teched” containing a few sample files. To determine the correct value for the include path, simply examine the document’s URL — it reveals the folder structure that can be referenced in your pipeline configuration.

https://sap.sharepoint.com/sites/210637/Shared%20Documents/teched/Board%20Onsite%20San%20Marino.docx

Given an link roughly like this - I would now use the following path to limit the replication only to the teched folder: "/teched"

Note: We do not prepend the path with the /Shared%20Documents 

Check 3: Pipeline created but no documents

How to check - see this documentation page. It's pretty straight forward. Whenever you create a pipeline to a site - it will in a matter of  a few minutes trigger a replication job. You can then see the status of that execution and determine what is going on. Sometimes this might lead to a empty list of documents. This usually points to a issue.

If you’re not seeing any documents, you may have defined the include path too narrowly. In that case, I recommend first testing with the root path—that is, omit the include path entirely. Once replication works, you can refine the configuration in subsequent iterations to identify which parts of your SharePoint content are being synchronized.

Keep in mind that, due to the historical evolution of SharePoint, not all structures are recognized as valid document libraries. For example, subsites are no longer supported by Document Grounding, as this feature has been deprecated in SharePoint itself. If your content resides in a subsite, the only reliable solution is to migrate it to a standard site and its associated document library.

Conclusion:

If you can answer the following questions with yes - then you succeeded in the troubleshooting

Did the pipeline get created with a 201 status code and a pipeline_id? 
Are any documents showing up for the pipeline execution? 
Does Joule answer my questions about the documents?

Hope you enjoyed the blog post and in case of any other symptoms you found - feel free to comment below.

entry.title: SFTP Sender Adapter – How to send multiple picked files as single email with all attachments
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I have an SFTP Sender Adapter configured in SAP CPI (Integration Suite) to pick multiple files from a folder. The file names start with a specific prefix — for example, "XYZ*" (e.g., XYZ_001.txt, XYZ_002.txt, etc.).

The current behavior:
Each file picked by the SFTP sender is processed separately and sent in individual emails through the Mail Receiver Adapter.

Expected behavior:
I want to collect all the files picked in one polling cycle and send them together in a single email, with each file attached separately in that one email.

Question:

  • How can I achieve this in CPI?

  • Is there any standard configuration or known pattern (like a Gather or Aggregator) that can be applied for this scenario?

  • If using an Aggregator/Gather step, how can we ensure all files picked in a single poll are aggregated before sending the email?

Any pointers or example iFlow design would be really helpful.

entry.title: Which table contains the API states of ABAP objects?
entry.content:
I want to query the API States (contracts) of function modules.

 

How can I do it?

Thanks

Sandra

entry.title: Re: Which table contains the API states of ABAP objects?
entry.content:
You may do this query:

SELECT *
       FROM ars_w_api_state
       WHERE sub_object_type = 'FUNC'
       INTO TABLE (function_module_api_states).

Result:

Verification for BAPI_CONVERSION_EXT2INT1:

The released API to read the API State of a given function module is:

DATA(function_module) = xco_cp_abap_repository=>object->fugr->for( 'BACV'
                     )->function_module( 'BAPI_CONVERSION_EXT2INT1' ).
DATA(api_state) = function_module->get_api_state( ).
DATA(release_state) = api_state->get_release_state( ).
ASSERT release_state->value = 'RELEASED'.

entry.title: Re: Why is BOM Header Not Transferred to Project in Auto...
entry.content:
1.  Are you using Configurable materials - Variant Configuration to create the Sales Order BOM?  If you are using CS61 it doesn't look like you have Configurable Materials. I see in the original question you are using VC.

There is an inconsistency in your business processes.  If you already have a complete Sales Order BOM why are you using PS BOM transfer to order lower level components?  All you need to do is feed the requirement reservation from the Sales Order to MRP and let MRP explode the BOM.

The usual case for using PS BOM Transfer is to pre-order materials prior to exploding a higher level material.

If you are putting the Configurable Material on the Sales Order and going through the configuration steps you should not need to order lower level components on a PS project.  Rather than putting the Configurable Material on a Sales Order you can add it to a PS project and the configuration steps can be done there.

entry.title: Mass Data Management extended to support Job Relationships
entry.content:
In H2 2025 release the Mass Data Management tool will be extended to include Job Relationship to support Job information and Positions.

Processing mass transactions is critical for any organization irrespective of the size. Being able to support mass changes to job relationships is key to supporting this.

Even if you have already configured the Mass Data Management object for positions and job information you will need to do this for Job Relationships.

Once it is configured create a Mass Change in Mass Data Management, selecting the Job Relationship you would like to update.

This will then show you all the people ‘Tessa Walker’ is the HR Manager for.

You can select the employees you wish to update, then click edit.

Search for the employee who will be the new HR Manager and click apply.  This will create the draft.

 

You can the review the changes and submit the request.

For Jeffrey Hilton we now see that the HR Manager has been updated accordingly.

This is a valuable new feature added to Mass Data Management tool.

entry.title: SAP ERP (ECC 6.0 on RISE) Integration with DRC Peppol Exchange – Questions for Belgium Setup
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

This is my first time implementing the integration between SAP ERP and SAP Document and Reporting Compliance (DRC) for Peppol Exchange, following SAP’s official documentation:
https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-edition/sap-document-and-reporting-compliance-cloud-edition/integrating-peppol-exchange-with-sap-erp?locale=en-US

However, I find the documentation quite high-level — it doesn’t go deep enough into the technical aspects, and I’m a bit confused about certain configuration points.

Context

I’m currently implementing the integration between SAP ERP ECC 6.0 (SAP RISE) and SAP Document and Reporting Compliance (DRC) – Peppol Exchange for Belgium (BE).

So far, all the main configuration tasks have been completed:

  • The eDocument Cockpit is fully configured and working correctly in SAP ECC.

  • SAP DRC Peppol Exchange is deployed on SAP BTP (region: Frankfurt).

  • The ERP system is hosted on SAP RISE (region: Virginia).

  • The Cloud Connector is configured and connected to the corresponding BTP subaccount.

  • The Service Binding and Destination (DRC_PEPPOL) were successfully created in BTP.

  • A communication user with all necessary authorizations (SAP_BC_WEBSERVICE_SERVICE_USER, EDO_*, etc.) has been created.

  • The service endpoint in SOAMANAGER has been correctly configured and exposed according to SAP’s documentation at the following path:
    /sap/bc/srt/rfc/sap/dcppushservice/<xxx>/dcppushservice/pushrequest.

Despite all this, the connection between the ERP and the DRC Cloud Peppol service still cannot be established.
Ping tests return errors such as NIEHOST_UNKNOWN, NIECONN_REFUSED, or “Service Unreachable.”

At this point, I’m not sure whether the issue is related to:

  • Certificate or trust configuration between ERP and BTP,

  • A network limitation due to the cross-region setup (RISE Virginia ↔ BTP Frankfurt),

  • Or something missing in the Peppol participant configuration within the DRC instance.

Additionally, I’m unsure whether I should ask the client to explicitly allow outbound communication from the DRC Cloud service binding (created in BTP) through SAP’s internal firewall so that the ERP system can reach the endpoint.
If so, I would appreciate guidance on how this should be done — whether it should be managed directly in BTP Cockpit, via a SAP support ticket, or if it is enabled automatically once the binding is created.

Finally, the client assumes that XML ↔ UBL transformations must be handled via SAP Integration Suite (CPI), but based on my understanding, the standard SAP DRC solution should already manage these conversions internally.

1 Connection between RISE (Virginia) and BTP (Frankfurt)

Given that the ERP (RISE) and BTP environments are hosted in different regions, do I need to configure an additional SAP Cloud Connector or any special setup to enable secure communication between the two?
Or is the standard connection through the Service Binding and Destination configuration sufficient for DRC Cloud to reach the on-premise ERP?

2 eDocument Format and UBL/BIS 3.0 Transformation

According to SAP’s documentation, Peppol requires UBL BIS 3.0-compliant documents.
My main questions are:

  • Does the standard DRC solution automatically handle the XML → UBL BIS 3.0 transformation when sending eDocuments from SAP ERP to Peppol?

  • Conversely, when receiving documents from Peppol, does DRC automatically convert UBL BIS → XML so that it can be consumed by SAP ERP?

  • If these transformations are not handled natively, what’s the recommended approach to implement them?
    Specifically, how can I connect SAP DRC Cloud with SAP Integration Suite (iFlow) to intercept and transform the payload (UBL/XML) before it reaches the ERP?
    (I would really appreciate if anyone has implemented a similar setup or could share a best-practice example.)

I would also appreciate any insights on special settings that should be considered in the eDocument Cockpit for sending and/or receiving documents.

3. RISE and ECC Connectivity Considerations

The client refers to their system as SAP RISE, but technically the backend is SAP ECC 6.0.
Are there any official SAP guidelines or technical notes describing the recommended configuration for this hybrid scenario (RISE + DRC Cloud) — especially regarding trust setup, certificates, or communication channels?
The existing SAP documentation seems too generic, so any deeper or experience-based guidance would be very helpful.

Thank you in advance for your help and insights!
Any detailed documentation, SAP Notes, or examples from similar Belgium Peppol implementations would be highly appreciated.

entry.title: Onboard External Repository which is "Http content server" in to SAP DMS
entry.content:
Onboard External Repository which is "Http content server" in to SAP DMS.I need to onboard existing external repository which is connected to SAP S4HANA System. It is a HTTP Content server kind of repository which we want to use and onboard into SAP BTP DMS.  I am trying using Integration option .

entry.title: ACC_DOCUMENT04 IDoc Error: Posting to Statistical IO with a Profitability Segment (PSG)
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I'm encountering an issue while posting a G/L document using they goal is to post line items to a Profitability Segment (PSG) as the real cost object and also to a statistical Internal Order for reporting purposes.

The Internal Order is correctly configured with the "Statistical" indicator active. While the posting works perfectly when I use a Cost Center as the real object, it fails when I use a Profitability Segment. With a PSG, the system seems to incorrectly treat the statistical IO as a real object, leading to an error.

I have already tried using the field E1BPACFL09-STAT_CON = 'X' to explicitly flag the line item as statistical. However, when this is set along with the PSG data, the entire G/L line item is simply dropped from the final accounting document.

The business requirement is to use statistical orders to track project costs, while the true posting must go to CO-PA. My background is in FI, so I am still developing my CO expertise. I would be grateful for any insights on the following:

  1. Is it a standard SAP limitation that a Profitability Segment and a statistical Internal Order cannot be used together on a single line item in the ACC_DOCUMENT04 IDoc?

  2. Am I missing a specific field or configuration in the IDoc that is required for this scenario?

  3. If this approach is not possible, could you suggest an alternative for achieving a real posting to CO-PA with a simultaneous statistical posting to an Internal Order via an interface?

Thank you in advance for your help!

entry.title: 2H 2025 - Release highlights of SuccessFactors Calibration
entry.content:
Hi Community,

The 2H 2025 release is here!

A new set of enhancements has been released in the 2H 2025 release that has been eagerly awaited. The SAP SuccessFactors 2H 2025 Release includes some key features and enhancements, so let's take a closer look!

1- Auto-Activate Calibration Sessions:

To simplify the activation of multiple sessions scheduled at different times and reduce manual effort, you can schedule a job to automatically activate sessions based on the template. You can also enforce session activation even if some subjects fail validation.

Enablement: Customer configured

A new setting Auto-activate sessions has been added to the Advanced tab of the template at Admin Center>Manage Calibration Templates.

Configuration Requirements:

  • You've enabled Auto-activate sessions under the Advanced tab of the template at Admin Center>Manage Calibration Templates.
  • You've set activation date at the template level or session level.
  • You've created job requests to auto-activate sessions.

Role-Based Permission Prerequisites:

  • You have the Administrator Permissions>Manage Calibration>Manage Calibration Templates permission.
  • You have the Administrator Permissions>Admin Center Permissions>Manage Scheduled Jobs permission.

2- Comments from Other Calibration Sessions Now Counted:

The comment function enables permitted session reviewers to leave explanations on rating changes and share feedback with other reviewers in the sessions that are in progress.

In the subject list, the comment icon next to each subject now shows a total count of comments from both the current and any other sessions that are based on the same template. When you open the comment dialog box, you can view separate counts and comments on the From This Session and From Other Sessions tabs. The counts update automatically when you add or delete comments in any session.

Enablement: Customer Configured

Configuration Requirements:

  • You have enabled Roll up comments from the other sessions based on the same template under the Advanced tab of the template at Admin Center>Manage Calibration Templates.

Role-Based Permission Prerequisites:

  • You have the Administrator Permissions>Manage Calibration>Manage Calibration Templates permission.

 

3- Exclude Contingent Workers When Creating Calibration Sessions:

Contingent workers can automatically remove from the list of participants and subjects when you create sessions through the following ways:

  • You create sessions using the Manage Calibration Sessions tool.
  • Managers create sessions directly on the landing page of Calibration.
  • You create multiple calibration sessions using a validated CSV file.

Enablement: Customer Configured

Configuration Requirements:

  • You've enabled Exclude Contingent Workers from Session Creation under Admin Center>Manage Calibration Settings>Global Settings.

4- Rating Change History Available in Calibration Sessions:

You can now track rating changes in calibration sessions.

In each calibration session, you can view rating change history to learn about previous rating changes. The Old Rating and New Rating columns not only display the rating label but also includes the corresponding rating value. Additionally, you will see details regarding who made each change and the exact time it occurred.

 Enablement: Automatically On

 

For a detailed release summary, check out the “What’s New Viewer” for a list of enhancements across the application.

entry.title: SAP Ariba Procurement Solutions for Lifesciences & Healthcare customers
entry.content:
In this post, we consider a common usecase for pharmaceutical companies: the procurement of Active Pharmaceutical Ingredients (APIs) from approved contract manufacturers (CMO) or suppliers.

User Story

As a production planner in a mid-size pharmaceutical company, I need to procure an API only from approved manufacturers (CMO), verify the regulatory documents for completeness, correctness, and validity, so that the purchase can be processed without compliance risks or delays.

Personas Involved

  • Production Planner (using MM on ERP)
  • Category Buyer (Using  SAP Ariba Category Management )
  • Quality Assurance Approver (using SAP Ariba Supplier Lifecycle and Performance & SAP Ariba Supplier Risk )
  • Supplier Manufacturer (using the SAP Business Network for Suppliers )
  • Supplier Risk Analyst (using SAP Ariba Supplier Risk)
  • AP Invoice Processor (SAP Ariba Invoicing

System Recommendations & Assumptions

  • Supplier/Contract Manufacturer can be sourced using Ariba Guided Sourcing and onboarded using SAP Ariba SLP , continuously monitored for risks (ESG, financial, regulatory, etc.) using SAP Ariba Supplier Risk.

 

  • Possibility to invite customers for a sourcing event in   SAP Ariba Sourcing, based on their qualification and risk status as well as ability to fulfill the business n
  • At the end of the sourcing event, a supplier will be selected.

The Supplier 360 dashboard on SLP can be used to view supplier details.

  • Suppliers can be qualified and registered using SLP, where status, certification information, risk information, etc., can be maintained and viewed. GxP relevant certificates (GMP certificate, DMF/CEP references, country-specific permits) can be used for supplier qualification.
  • Contracts can be created using baseline contract templates in Ariba.
  • The API material can be maintained in ERP with a unique material code. Manufacturer’s substance codes and parent-child code mappings can also be maintained in ERP.

End-to-end Flow ( Considering PR originates in ERP, for direct material procurement) 

  • ERP:
    • MRP run creates a PR for API-12345 for supplier AKME Systems for 50 kgs with a delivery deadline of 4 weeks
  • PR Sent to Ariba Buying/Guided Buying :
    • The PR is sent to Ariba Buying/Guided Buying for collaboration and approvals.
    • Information related to parent-child codes mapping, a reference list of approved suppliers, etc. is also sent.
  • Category Buyer Review :
    • The category buyer in Ariba Guided Buying reviews the PR and confirms the supplier/manufacturer pairing.
    • Custom fields display required information like manufacturer's codes, parent code, DMF, etc.
  • QA Approval :
    • As part of QA approval, following checks could be considered: 
      • Ensuring the CMO/supplier is approved in SLP and not expired,
      • Verification parent-child codes match the ERP records,
      • Validation of country permits,
      • Verification of other documents and certificates like GXP relevant, FDA approval, etc.

            If all checks are fine, then PR will be approved, else returned with comments. 

  • PO Creation in Ariba Guided Buying : 
    • A PO is created in Guided Buying and sent to the supplier via SAP Business Network / SCC.
    • It is possible to add conditions to ensure that no PO is created without QA approval. 

Ariba Buying for creating PO

  • Supplier Confirmation via SAP Business Network/SCC:
    • The supplier confirms PO quantities and delivery dates. 
    • Provides a shipment plan and ASN (Advance Ship Notice) with batch number, expected lot (UoM), CoA (Certificate of Analysis), other certificates relevant for GMP, export/import permits, etc. 

SAP Business Network

Supplier can also proactively create Quality Notifications in SAP Business Network / SCC, in order to communicate to the buyer about quality issues like defects in the products, non-confirming items, etc. 

  • S/4HANA or ERP Processing : 
    • The integration with S/4 HANA ensures that the confirmation and ASN data is received by the production planner.
    • The Quality Assurance Approver also receives notification using QM. 
  • Goods Receipt in S/4HANA :
    • GR is posted by the warehouse for received batches.
  • Supplier PO-Flip on the SAP Business Network/SCC :
    • The supplier can perform PO-flip and send the invoice electronically. 
    • Ariba Invoicing runs 3-way match (PO,GR,Invoice). If the match is successful, invoice is posted for payment. 
  • Auditing and Reporting : 
    • An audit trail of approvals, documents and timestamps is maintained for auditing and reporting purpose in Ariba.
    • integration with SAP Analytics Dashboard also helps the buyer in accessing analytical reports and checking various metrics. 
  • Continuous Risk Monitoring :
    • SAP Ariba Supplier Risk performs 24/7 monitoring for geopolitical risks, social & environmental risks, financial risks like bankruptcy, cyber threats, sanctions list changes, etc. 
    • Alerts are raised for risk situation changes, supplier status changes, etc. based on the configuration of users. An alternate supplier can be recommended based on the qualified suppliers listed for the same category. 

SAP Ariba Supplier Risk

Please read my blogs Boosting Procurement Efficiency in 2024 with SAP Ariba Supplier Risk & Best Practices for effective supplier risk management with SAP Ariba for more information on SAP Ariba Supplier Risk.

To conclude, SAP Ariba, integrated with SAP S/4HANA, offers a comprehensive solution for the life sciences and healthcare industry, addressing the complexities of API procurement. By leveraging these tools, companies can enhance supplier management, compliance, efficiency, and overall supply chain resilience.

Stay tuned for our next blog, where we will explore how SAP Ariba procurement solutions could help with the compliance requirements of regulated industries like life sciences and healthcare.

entry.title: Mail body is shown in SOST but not in the email received in outlook
entry.content:
Hello Team - We can see body of the email in SOST. But when it is delivered to outlook, it doesn't show the body, its empty. Status of these emails in SOST is "Sent" whereas for other emails its "Transmitted". 

SOST:

Outlook:

Please help !

Here is the code I used:

  " Subject of the eMail
  lv_subject = |Work Order Notification - { lv_aufnr }|.

  " Prepare Body of the eMail
  APPEND |<html><body>| TO lt_email_body. " 1st line - HTML Tag Beginning

  IF lwa_jest_old-stat = ''.
	APPEND |Order # { lv_aufnr } is created. <br> <br>| TO lt_email_body.
  ELSE.
	APPEND |Status of the work order # "{ lv_aufnr } - { caufvd_imp-ktext }" is changed from <b> { lwa_tj30t_old-txt30 } </b> to <b> { lwa_tj30t_new-txt30 }</b>. <br> <br>| TO lt_email_body.
  ENDIF.

  APPEND 'Navigate to the Work Order by clicking here: ' TO lt_email_body.

  CASE sy-sysid.
	WHEN 'SND'.
	  DATA(lv_url_start) = 'https://sandboxURL/'.
	WHEN 'DEV'.
	  lv_url_start = 'https://DevURL/'.
	WHEN 'QAS'.
	  lv_url_start = 'https://QAURL/'.
	WHEN 'PRD'.
	  lv_url_start = 'https://ProdURL/'.
  ENDCASE.

  " URL for the order
  DATA(lv_url) = lv_url_start && '<Link to Fiori App>(' &&
  |'{ lv_aufnr }'| && ')/?<Continue Link to Fiori App>'.
  APPEND |<a href="{ lv_url }">| TO lt_email_body.
  APPEND | { lv_aufnr } - { caufvd_imp-ktext } </a><br><br>| TO lt_email_body.

  APPEND |</html></body>| TO lt_email_body. " 1st line - HTML Tag Ending

  TRY.
	  "Create send request
	  lr_send_request = cl_bcs=>create_persistent( ).

	  " Sender Details
	  lr_sender = cl_sapuser_bcs=>create( 'BATCH_USER' ).

	  "Add sender to send request
	  CALL METHOD lr_send_request->set_sender
		EXPORTING
		  i_sender = lr_sender.

	  " Add Created by as 1st receiver
	  SELECT SINGLE ernam FROM qmel INTO @DATA(lv_ernam)
		WHERE qmnum = @caufvd_imp-qmnum.
	  lv_receiver = |{ lv_ernam }@abc.com|.
	  lr_recipient = cl_cam_address_bcs=>create_internet_address( lv_receiver ).
	  "Add Created By to send request
	  CALL METHOD lr_send_request->add_recipient
		EXPORTING
		  i_recipient = lr_recipient
		  i_express   = 'X'.

	  " Also send eMail to tool owner(S)
	  IF NOT lt_tool_owner[] IS INITIAL.
		LOOP AT lt_tool_owner ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<fsl_tool_owner>).
		  CLEAR: lv_receiver, lr_recipient.
		  lv_receiver = |{ <fsl_tool_owner>-parnr }@abc.com|.
		  lr_recipient = cl_cam_address_bcs=>create_internet_address( lv_receiver ).
		  "Add recipient(s) to send request
		  CALL METHOD lr_send_request->add_recipient
			EXPORTING
			  i_recipient = lr_recipient
			  i_express   = 'X'.
		ENDLOOP.
	  ENDIF.

	  " Created eMail body
	  lr_document = cl_document_bcs=>create_document(
					   i_type    = 'HTM'
					   i_text    = lt_email_body
					   i_length  = '12'
					   i_subject = lv_subject ).

	  "Add document to send request
	  CALL METHOD lr_send_request->set_document( lr_document ).

	  "Send email
	  CALL METHOD lr_send_request->send(
		EXPORTING
		  i_with_error_screen = 'X'
		RECEIVING
		  result              = lv_sent_to_all ).

	  "Exception handling
	CATCH cx_bcs INTO lr_bcs_exception.
	  MESSAGE e002(zeam) WITH lr_bcs_exception->error_type. " Error in sending eamil notification: &1

entry.title: Kyma Application Cannot Send Traces to the Telemetry Module (RBAC: Access Denied)
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

We wanted to perform some tracing tests on our Kyma cluster with the Telemetry module enabled.
For this purpose, we deployed the OpenTelemetry Demo application in our custom namespace, following the guide:

Kyma OpenTelemetry Demo Integration

All prerequisites were completed successfully. Our telemetry backend is OctoBus — the connection to it works, and we can see logs arriving there. However, the demo application is not able to send traces and logs to the dedicated Telemetry gateways.
We see the following errors in the application logs:

[Error] File: /opentelemetry-cpp/exporters/otlp/src/otlp_grpc_log_record_exporter.cc:173
[OTLP LOG GRPC Exporter] Export() failed: RBAC: access denied

[Error] File: /opentelemetry-cpp/exporters/otlp/src/otlp_grpc_exporter.cc:159
[OTLP TRACE GRPC Exporter] Export() failed with status_code: "PERMISSION_DENIED" error_message: "RBAC: access denied"

The logs are visible in OctoBus, so they are probably being collected by the log agent(s). Do we need any additional configuration (e.g., custom Roles or Istio AuthorizationPolicies), or is the demo app expected to work out of the box?

Thanks in advance for your help!

Lozan

entry.title: Product Direction and Evolution of the New Table Build Experience
entry.content:
Introduction

This document reflects the status of the Table Build Experience in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) as of Q3 2025.

It aims to guide story designers and stakeholders during the transition to the new experience and to provide visibility into its planned evolution.

Please note that some features and restrictions are temporary and subject to change as SAP continues to enhance SAC in upcoming releases.

 

The New Table Build Experience

With the Q3 2025 release, SAP Analytics Cloud introduces the new Table Build Experience for the Optimized Design Mode.

This redesign marks a major step forward in how tables are created, configured, and consumed in SAC.

The new experience offers a more intuitive workflow for story designers, aligning closely with the Chart Builder, while also laying the foundation for future innovations.

All new capabilities and innovations introduced with this experience are detailed in the following SAP Community article:

🔗The New Table Building Experience in SAP Analytics Cloud

In short, the new Table Build Experience is not just a cosmetic update. It represents a strategic foundation for SAC.

 

Existing Unsupported Features and Restrictions

As with any major redesign, the initial release does not yet offer full feature parity with the legacy table, which is why the new Table Build Experience is currently available through an Opt-In option.

While the core capabilities are already in place, some features are still under development.

The complete and up-to-date list of unsupported features and restrictions (as of QRC3 2025) is available in the official documentation:

🔗Unsupported Features and Restrictions: New Table Build Experience

These limitations are important to keep in mind, especially when switching to the New Table Build Experience.

However, they should be viewed in context: these limitations are temporary by nature and will progressively be removed.

 

Product Direction for the New Table Build Experience

Many of the current gaps are expected to be closed in the near future, with several already addressed as SAC continues to harmonize and extend its table capabilities.

The following roadmap illustrates what and when SAP plans to lift the current restrictions and achieve full feature parity.

 

Share Your Feedback

We want this transition to the New Table Build Experience to be as smooth and valuable as possible.

Your feedback directly helps us improve both the product and its documentation.

Please let us know your thoughts, your input is highly appreciated and will actively influence future enhancements to SAP Analytics Cloud.

entry.title: Re: Intelligent Application - Why is Data stored twice in...
Re: SAP Datasphere - Architecture and Lessons-Learned
entry.content:
Hi @PMathieu ,

Wow! I was not expecting this incredible reply to my article. Thank you!

Just some additional comments as I think we're on the same journey:

  • 2A/3A. The Acquisition Space makes a lot of sense as the data engineers (not business analysis) will be handling the connections and replication flows. I consider this the PSA layer for those who used to work with classic SAP BW.
  • 2B/3B. Where I've ran into issue with a blended modeling and reporting space is the copying of the analytical models. A client wanted to copy an analytical model from their blended IT modeling space (that contained the underlying views, fact, and analytical model) to a business space and I ran into many issues. It was much simpler to share the fact and then create the analytical model in the business space.

The dedicated reporting space (containing the analytical models) have been used at two of my recent clients with great success. Our business analysts can update KPI expressions or create new ones to their heart's content. 

By the way, you should publish your reply as it's own stand-alone article. You defined the approach much better 🙂

entry.title: Need clarification on scope item activation and deactivation during Initial Scoping
entry.content:
Dear SAP Support Team,


We are currently implementing SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud for our client Tasty Bite and have successfully completed the Explore phase. We are now preparing to initiate the Central Business Configuration (CBC) for our development tenant.


Before proceeding, we seek clarification on the following points related to scope item activation and deactivation:


  1. Scope Items Available Only During Initial Scoping
    Could you please provide a comprehensive list of all scope items that can only be activated during the initial scoping phase of CBC? We would also appreciate details on their functional usability and impact.



  2. Scope Items That Cannot Be Deactivated Once Activated
    Kindly confirm which scope items, once activated and deployed, cannot be removed or deactivated in future CBC change projects. This will help us ensure proper planning and avoid irreversible configurations.



We understand that certain scope items are foundational and may have dependencies that restrict their flexibility post-deployment. If there is an official SAP document or Excel file (e.g., “Availability and Dependencies of Scope Items”) that outlines these constraints, please share the latest version or direct us to the appropriate location.


Looking forward to your guidance to ensure a smooth and compliant CBC configuration process.


Best regards,


Sumit Chordiya


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Need clarification on scope item activation and deact...
entry.content:
Hello Sumit,   

With the latest 2506 SAP Central Business Configuration release, a new filter has been introduced in the Define Scope app. This filter allows you to view scope items available during the Initial Scoping phase. For detailed information, you can refer to the SAP Community post What’s New in SAP Central Business Configuration 2506 FD2 and the KBA 3425018 - How to check whether a scope item is only available for initial scoping in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition - SAP for Me.

Regarding scope item exclusions, please note that this action cannot be performed once certain activities are completed. Here are the two scenarios:  
- If the Define Scope activity has been completed by clicking the "Complete Activity" button, workspace deletion is possible and you can start again in a new workspace without the need of reprovision.
- However, once the Deploy Scope and Organizational Structure activity is completed, the scope item content is automatically activated in your system. At this point, the workspace progresses to the Product-Specific Configuration phase, and deactivation by workspace deletion is no longer possible. If the scope item needs to be removed, a reprovisioning process will be required. This is outlined in the KBA  3255117 - Not possible to delete scope items (scenarios) after activating it - SAP for Me 

Lastly, to check the available scope items and their provisioning status, you can use the Availability and dependencies of scope items list with the last updates. For guidance on utilizing this file is provided in the 3539934 - How-to use the "Availability and dependencies of scope items list" when activating Scope Items.

Additional information can also be found in the KBA 3122430 - Scope item activation request for SAP Central Business Configuration - SAP for Me  

Best regards,

Marcelo

entry.title: Re: Request for Solution: Asset Retirement to Customer in...
entry.content:
Hello @ahsanali 

Retiring an asset to a customer (integrated with Accounts Receivable) is done via the Fiori app Post Retirement (Integrated AR) with Customer, as mentioned @BobShen  in his post.

There is no public OData API to post the integrated AR plus Asset Accounting document, and there is no standard mass retirement capability with customers. SAP Help Portal-Post Retirement (Integrated AR) – With Customer

If there is a requirement for upload-style throughput while maintaining integrated posting, the recommended method is to automate F-92 using SAP Build Process Automation (RPA). SAP-Automate mass updates of asset master data in SAP S/4HANA

The Fixed Asset, Post Asset Retirement API manages only non-integrated retirements, without a customer. Some mass-retirement content on the Accelerator Hub also uses this route API.SAP.com-Fixed Asset – Post Asset Retirement

With best regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Attachments in PR & PO
entry.content:
Hi,

Attachments are managed separately via the Attachment Service (Generic Object Services - GOS) and are not directly linked to the procurement BAdIs or standard business object structures. Hence, the system cannot validate or enforce attachment requirements during PR/PO creation or update via standard configuration. 

Kindly refer to the KBA https://me.sap.com/notes/0003664699

SAP Customer Influence enables customers to submit improvement requests and to openly vote on them.

These voting results inform SAP of product enhancements and changes customers are most interested in seeing in future releases.

1. Get started by opening SAP Customer Influence SAP Continuous Influence sessions for SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition

2. Register and accept the Terms of Use

3. Choose a session of your interest

4. Create and submit your improvement request

5. Take a look at existing improvement requests and start voting and commenting

Thanks and regards,

SAP Support
